bibl.title: Despatch from Beverly Y. Payne to Goerge L. Rives, April 2, 1888
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p: Consulate General of the United States Monrovia, LIberia, April 2nd 1888
Mr B. Y. Payne to they Assistant Secretary of State.
Quarterly returns from the Consulate Agency at Elmina GOld Coast Colony.

Sir, I have the honor respectfully to foreward you the quarterly returns for the quarter ended September 30th 1887 and December 31st 1887. of the Consular Agency at Elmina, Gold Coast, Colony. Please find enclosures enclosures
Two arrivals and Departures of vessels #1. Two Detail Report of official service #2. Two Summary of business #3. One Digest of Invoice book #4. One Return of Trade with the United States #5.
I regret exceedingly that I have not transmitted them returnsbefore now, my reason for not doing so, was as stated in my No 7 C the delusive instruction of Mr. Taylor.
I have the honor to be Sir Your obedient Servant
Hon., George L. Rives Ass't Sec'y of State
